intro: Gouania eriocarpa var. macrophylla, commonly known as the giant gouania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter, making it a striking addition to tropical gardens. The plant produces showy yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It is native to Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
